name: Intrro
slogan: Use your employees’ networks to find your dream hires
description:
Intrro helps companies uncover, engage and source the best talent from their employees' networks, resulting in lower costs of hiring (no agency fees), a quicker process and better longevity with hires (as they are all referrals). 
 
The way we do this is by connecting your employees' social networks (LinkedIn, FB, Github, Dribble, Gmail, etc) and using our bespoke algorithms we match their connections with your new job openings; you can then request your employee to make the introduction to the candidate and check whether they are interested in exploring opportunities at your company. 

Hiring can cripple a business in terms of both time and money; all of the data suggests that hiring through referrals provides not only the cheapest avenue to hire but the highest in quality too. Intrro allows a company to do that seamlessly in a very affordable way, across all business lines.

team.name: Nasser Oudjidane
team.bioHtml: Founder @Intrro • Worked at @Adecco

team.name: Amil Asokan
team.bioHtml:
Pro level expertise in UI/UX. Love creating modern designs and concept designs.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.description:
We’re a funded, early-stage start-up based in London & Tbilisi, building an innovative SaaS platform changing the way fast-growing companies hire the best talent. 

You will be based in our Tbilisi offices working closely together with our tech/product team, implementing NLP/ML models.

This role is an opportunity for a smart, curious data scientist who has a demonstrated interest in working in a customer-centric technology company, to help create the next generation hiring platform.

What we offer:

Competitive pay
Employee stock option plan
Unlimited annual leave
Flexi-working hours
Drinks and Snacks
Health Insurance
Gym Membership or Mobile Plan
Monthly events
Quarterly trips

jobs.title: Growth Marketing
jobs.description:
Who are we?

We’re a funded, early-stage start up in London, building an innovative SaaS platform. Our tech team is based in Georgia & Poland and we have ambitious, but smart, plans to scale quickly. 

Right now, we’re hiring the first members of our team to join us on our journey where you’ll play a pivotal role in determining the direction of the company with real ownership...

So what's this role all about...

• Define B2B marketing strategies:  constantly experimenting with ideas to target our ideal customers, developing propositions and shaping pricing and positioning.
• Drive lead generation, nurturing and conversion across primarily outbound channels, including email, social, search, referrals and partnerships.
• Collaborate with design teams; optimising product messaging and UX to improve engagement and conversion rates.
• Build lifecycle marketing programmes to retain customers, implementing best practices in CRM and automation.
• Design and implement tracking plans, reporting on product and commercial metrics.
• Collaborate with sales and BD teams to optimise sales cycles, operations and processes.
• Inform sales collateral - including pitch decks, and presentations - with consideration for techniques in negotiation and persuasion.
• Coach founders and other teams in B2B marketing best practices.
• Being hands-on with a wide range of analytics, marketing and automation tools.

Let’s talk about all those lovely skills required!

• Possess an avid interest in technology and experimental zeal.
• Entrepreneurial, with an enthusiasm for early-stage startups.
• Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with founders and portfolio teams.
• Have personality:- ‘Be You’ and don’t be afraid to make mistakes, remember you'll be learning on the job!
• Experience interning for a startup or an advertising agency (Nice To Have)
• 2:1 Degree educated (Nice To Have)
• Demonstrated ability with CRM software, e.g. Hubspot, Salesforce or Pipedrive. (Nice to have)
• Working knowledge of sales operations and KPIs e.g. lead velocity, pipeline values, win rates. (Nice to have.)

What’s in it for you?

• Competitive Salary + Equity (Share Options)
• Swanky co-working space in London’s most active startup location
• 22 Days + 8 Public Bank Holidays
• Office Concessions (breakfast, snacks, coffee/tea, beers, fruit and of course - Haribo )
• Team Socials, Challenges & Off-sites
• Gym Membership ️‍♂️
• As an early stage startup, you’ll have an opportunity to input into our culture, perks and policies

jobs.title: Internship
jobs.description:
Who are we?

We’re a funded, early-stage start-up in London, building an innovative SaaS platform changing the way fast-growing companies hire the best talent. Our tech team is based in Georgia & Poland and we have ambitious but smart plans to scale quickly.

So what's this role all about...

We are looking for an enthusiastic student or young graduate to join our team in London. 

You will work closely together with the CEO and Head of Marketing, on a wide range of tasks. Being an early-stage start-up, there is very little formality and lots of opportunities to get involved in all areas of the business and put your stamp on it!

You will be working in a small, growing start-up which will involve exposure to all aspects of the business – from product and design to marketing and operations, to resolving customer issues and sales. 

This role is an opportunity for a smart, curious generalist who has a demonstrated interest in working in a customer-centric technology company, to help create the next generation hiring platform.

Let’s talk about who you are…

•	Like a fish in water - we need you to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment. You can go left and right at the same time, split yourself like an atom, bounce around being scrappy, creative and resourceful all the while trying to build structure and process.
•	You take pride and ownership in your work to a point where only the best is good enough
•	You have high energy and a can-do attitude, along with a good sense of humor and resilience. 
•	You thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment and have exceptional multitasking and organisational abilities.
•	You are passionate about people, with a desire to build something meaningful 
•	You are a natural do-er with bias for action and a test-and-learn mentality.
•	You constantly think about how to improve the things around you and pitching in wherever the team needs support.
•	You would have recently completed an undergraduate degree from a leading university, or are nearly complete.
•	You have a capacity for hard work and the time available to dedicate yourself fully to an internship

What’s in it for you?

This is a chance to join an early-stage technology start-up setting out to make a material a difference in the way companies hire the best talent at the heart of London’s tech scene.

•	4-6 months internship with opportunities for the full-time employment thereafter 
•	Swanky co-working space in London’s most active startup location
•	Office Concessions (breakfast, snacks, coffee/tea, beers, fruit and of course - Haribo )
•	Team Socials, Challenges & Off-sites
•	As an early stage startup, you’ll have an opportunity to input into our culture, perks, and policies

To apply, please submit your CV specifying which internship program you are interested in, along with your short answers to the following questions:

•	Why are you interested in an internship at Intrro?
•	What do you think will be the most challenging part of the internship?
•	If Intrro could develop any new feature, what should it be and why?

No cover letters please, but any applications that do not include answers to the above questions will not be considered.

Our application process closes on Sunday 1st December 2019.

Please note that despite the high volume of applications we receive, we will still reply to you! If you take the time to apply, the least we can do is reply.
